reviews.text: Best shredded chilli beef in Manchester. Most places you get hard pipe cleaners - this place does it right. Rest of food is great as well if you are looking for something slightly different to your average English Chinese restaurant.  Good busy atmosphere with a largely Chinese client base - always a good sign.
Nice food, love the food there and reasonable price with reasonable portion. However, the tables are a bit crowd. But a good place to have Chinese food!
Good Chinese Food restaurant? you worth to try when you travelling to UK
Nice place but very small portion of meat.

Such a nice little restaurant. Service was great, staff are attentive without being in your face, portion size good, prices great. The only problem I have is quite a few items had been tagged as sold out.

This is a decent fine dining restaurant, but for the money, the flavours didn’t hit the spot. The plates and food looks beautiful - like works of art - but I found the flavours didn’t match up to the presentation. The service was excellent though ! The waiters are attentive and really professional. Overall it’s a decent experience but the prices for the food don’t necessarily align.

Fantastic service from the moment we arrived until the moment we left. The food was incredible, and the bar selection was great as well. Highlights included the Double Smoked Manhattan, the Lobster from the 9-course meal, and dessert!
Without a doubt the best food I have ever had. I'm not one to go out of my comfort zone but at Eden everything was so delicious. Great service, beautiful restaurant and amazing food.

Absolutely worth the money! Our group of four tried the four part tasting menu. The service was outstanding. I really enjoyed all of the cheese options. I recommend getting the pork ribs for an entree and blueberry dark chocolate for dessert. My whole table agreed these tasted best. Be sure to ask for a table near the windows with the best mountain view-- I wish we had done this.
Nice breakfast nice place to see with  good views
marie-louise taylor is not a nice person I know this  so she brings down the rest of the staff

Such a beautiful venue. Hidden behind old stone walls, you might have no idea that Chetham's has a maze of historic rooms, including the oldest public library in the English speaking world (which looks like it should have been used for the Harry Potter movies!) I particularly loved the original printing press with individual metal letters, and the books chained to their shelves. Well worth a visit.

My son attends the school and in his own words describes it as "a really happy environment".  The teachers are incredibly committed, the children are always smiling and the music and choir concerts are outstanding.  We feel very lucky to be part of such an amazing school.

An amazing library and banqueting hall dating back over 500 years, hidden away by Victoria station. Lucky enough to be fed and entertained in the banqueting hall and given a brief tour of the amazing library. 

It is open to the public, but check first as sometimes availability might cause closure. Awesome environment, and collection of books and prints from the 16th Century, including a first edition of Newtons' clever little maths book.

Try to visit.

My husband and I recently attended a recital at Chetham's School of Music. We were received warmly by staff and pupils and were impressed by the respectful interaction between those staff and pupils. It was delightful experience and a chance to marvel at the skill of the young people currently at the school. We look forward to further visits.

Excellent gallery with three floors to visit for the whole family. Paintings, pictures and sculptures. Lots of good exhibitions mostly free. Cafe provides food, snacks and drinks. Accessible for all people. Toilets always clean.

This gallery is a must see. It contains a diverse collection, all well presented.  The staff attitudes are welcoming. There are plenty of places to sit (galleries without ample seating are thoughtless and unwelcoming).  There is a cafe and plenty of very well maintained toilets. You can spend a lot of time here!

I highly recommend the free guided tour. The guide we had did an excellent job. It lasted for one hour and showcased a number of works on a particular theme chosen by the guide. This is a very good way to set up tours by volunteer guides since allowing them to choose their own theme and works to support it tends to mean they speak with knowledge and personal interest, making it that much more interesting.

When we visited, the gallery was giving away free prints of various works. These high-quality prints proved very popular I noticed. This was not only very generous, it is a very clever way to expand the reach of the gallery, exposing more people to art and hopefully encouraging a greater interest in the gallery.

Such a lovely display. Good portrayal of Modern, contemporary and traditional art. Most definitely work a visit. Can be quite busy at weekends and they close quite early so make sure you time it well. Quite central also so easy to get to by bus or tram, closest tram in St. Peter’s square. Piccadilly station is a 10 min walk away. Enjoy

I go to Manchester Art Gallery a few time every year. One of my favourites. It's worth a visit, and it always has new exhibitions and events going on! It's worth to point out, that it FREE entry. It's a very welcoming place. There's always someone at the entrance who is very helpful and will point you in the right direction.

I go to Manchester Art Gallery a few time every year. One of my favourites. It's worth a visit, and it always has new exhibitions and events going on! It's worth to point out, that it FREE entry. It's a very welcoming place. There's always someone at the entrance who is very helpful and will point you in the right direction.

Beautiful location but service makes Parisien waiter look good.....
When the serving staff at the central bar deem to acknowledge your existence (10 minutes in my case with a half full bar) the presentation is spot on.
Perhaps if the service wasn't included the staff would try harder and probably get bigger tips too!!
Lovely Grand Cafe setting. Very upmarket shops too. An overall fantastic experience!

Nice place with some high-end, though not exclusive shopping and dining. Especially good if you have more money than sense or just want to show off a little. Bit of a tourist trap in some sense, but food and drinks are decent.
Historic building next to the Bank of England. High End shopping with excellent dining.
This is a great venue in the City.  A Fortnum and Masons Art Deco bar, was not was I was expecting! I only stopped for a post work tipple , but will be sure to sample the menu on my next visit.
Good place to go with family, specially on weekends. Excellent sort of stores, easy access, clean and with plenty of bathroom. The only problem is that needs more seats on the food court.

I love the Arndale. You can find every price range and everything. Amazing choice of food places. Seems to be well run. Well done Manchester for having such a really good sgopping place. Information desks well placed. Cant grumble at all.

Beautiful place to visit and shop. Big parking, I recommend you pinpoint your car on map when you park lol. The shopping center is magnificent. Very beautiful and unique in style. I loved it. Excellent glass ceilings, a beautiful view from all side. I recommend visiting this place and shopping from it

Huge shopping mall.Varied choice of stores.Right in city centre with tram stops providing access to all sides.
You can spend hours here and enjoy the cafes and restaurants too.
A better selection of restaurants would be nice as its beyond boring to see the same name brands everywhere. The location then becomes irrelevant, other than that it's a standard shopping centre.
Good place to go with family, specially on weekends. Excellent sort of stores, easy access, clean and with plenty of bathroom. The only problem is that needs more seats on the food court.

I love the Arndale. You can find every price range and everything. Amazing choice of food places. Seems to be well run. Well done Manchester for having such a really good sgopping place. Information desks well placed. Cant grumble at all.

Beautiful place to visit and shop. Big parking, I recommend you pinpoint your car on map when you park lol. The shopping center is magnificent. Very beautiful and unique in style. I loved it. Excellent glass ceilings, a beautiful view from all side. I recommend visiting this place and shopping from it

Huge shopping mall.Varied choice of stores.Right in city centre with tram stops providing access to all sides.
You can spend hours here and enjoy the cafes and restaurants too.
A better selection of restaurants would be nice as its beyond boring to see the same name brands everywhere. The location then becomes irrelevant, other than that it's a standard shopping centre.

Delicious, gorgeous food.
Polite, efficient staff.
Great and not too expensive menu.
Incredibly presented food - a true work of art and a terrible shame to have to disturb the beauty in front of me on my plate and actually eat my meal.
Please go!! It's fab
We had a lovely fun time.  Food was lovely.  Staff was friendly and helpful especially Job very helpful very kind very thoughtful very polite and attentive.  Brought a special touch to our visit.
Food is so amazing, separate vegan menu with drinks is brilliant. Portions are big, great value. Lovely vibe and good service.

Overall a good service but can seem like they are overrun at times, leaving you to wait longer to make your order or pay the bill. But the staff and Service aren't bad in any way.
Layout is pleasant, but with the benches, I do wonder how someone with a wheelchair could fit without blocking either side of the tables.
There are quite a few stairs to the buttom, but a lift is available for those less abled. 
To me this is a place to hit and not miss though.
Amazing food and staff! Very attentive. Will be back!
Good place to go with family, specially on weekends. Excellent sort of stores, easy access, clean and with plenty of bathroom. The only problem is that needs more seats on the food court.

I love the Arndale. You can find every price range and everything. Amazing choice of food places. Seems to be well run. Well done Manchester for having such a really good sgopping place. Information desks well placed. Cant grumble at all.

Beautiful place to visit and shop. Big parking, I recommend you pinpoint your car on map when you park lol. The shopping center is magnificent. Very beautiful and unique in style. I loved it. Excellent glass ceilings, a beautiful view from all side. I recommend visiting this place and shopping from it

Huge shopping mall.Varied choice of stores.Right in city centre with tram stops providing access to all sides.
You can spend hours here and enjoy the cafes and restaurants too.
A better selection of restaurants would be nice as its beyond boring to see the same name brands everywhere. The location then becomes irrelevant, other than that it's a standard shopping centre.

Always friendly service and nice and speedy which is ideal for fitting into a lunch break. There's a good menu and seriate veggie and vegan menu. The weekday lunch deals are well priced, standard menu pricing is similar to Wagamamas.

Good for groups, couples and somewhere comfortable enough for solo dining. There's a small seating area outside and a lift provides wheelchair access to the main restaurant.

We've eaten there twice now on visits to Manchester.  We're one veggie, one vegan and two meaties, with mixed tolerance of spice, and the whole family really loved it.  All the food we've had was delicious and fresh and the service is really thoughtful and professional without being in your face.  Decor is quirky and cheerful.  Great place.

Usually love this place, but being told we've now gone 'straw-less', rendering me unable to drink a cocktail without brain freeze is just absurd. To make matters worse, I was told "people have started to bring their own straws now, actually". Really, have they? All for saving the planet, but logically and rationally, and not for the sake of an inane gesture.
Food is good, prices are decent and the staff are friendly.

I like the idea of the place with the fusion Asian cuisine but the seating was very uncomfortable, lighting was also bad. The food was nice but definitely overpriced for what it was. All meals were over 11 pounds but small in portion sizes. It was generally alright in taste but I would never return to pay that much for something that didn't seem that freshly made. The sauce just tasted more like a ready sauce from a packet added to some chicken and vegetables. They say you pay for experience and I don't mind doing that as long as the experience is good and it is decent value for the money I pay. This was disappointing. I'd like to add as well, even though most of the staff was nice, some were definitely dressed inappropriately. You don't wear a low cami and a disturbingly short skirt in a place where you want to charge more than your average pub. I could see the waitresse's bra clearly because the camisole was that low and see through. And when she turned around the back of the bra was visible too. Just unacceptable. I came here to enjoy a meal not look at someone stripping around. There should be a uniform or at least some clear guidelines to what the waiting staff can wear, bare shoulders, deep V necklines? Really? It's not 35°C inside or outside.  Also, long hair that's not tied up? A big no no, it can go in anyone's food. To say it was in the middle of two big shopping centres I was expecting higher standards.
Good place to go with family, specially on weekends. Excellent sort of stores, easy access, clean and with plenty of bathroom. The only problem is that needs more seats on the food court.

I love the Arndale. You can find every price range and everything. Amazing choice of food places. Seems to be well run. Well done Manchester for having such a really good sgopping place. Information desks well placed. Cant grumble at all.

Excellent glass ceilings, a beautiful view from all side. I recommend visiting this place and shopping from it

Huge shopping mall.Varied choice of stores.Right in city centre with tram stops providing access to all sides.
You can spend hours here and enjoy the cafes and restaurants too.
A better selection of restaurants would be nice as its beyond boring to see the same name brands everywhere. The location then becomes irrelevant, other than that it's a standard shopping centre.

It's fast cheap easy vegan food. It isn't the cleanest nicest place in the world but I'm fussy and I eat there. It's also open late. 

They need to make the garlic mayo better. It's weird and yellow. Look at Hellman's vegan mayo for inspiration ☺️

I just picked up a bowl of lentils and chickpeas as wanted some healthy comfort food and it was honestly the nicest thing I’ve eaten in such a long time. I almost went and got another portion. Really nice team there too. 👌

I took four of my friends for lunch after reading the glowing reviews. We weren’t disappointed one of my fried got the bean burger and enjoyed it, the rest of us got 3 curries and rice, very healthy and yummy, I had to add hot sauce to mine. We also got the Samosas, which were fresh and the service was so fast, and the owner also gave us all mints. We will be back to try more of the menu.
Ah man this place is good! Tasty. Vegan. Good prices. Friendly staff. The dal was the best I've tasted in a long time. Very nice place.

Tried this place as Earth Cafe was closed.  Don't be put off by what it looks like on the outside, as the food was absolutely beautiful.  It is also now completely vegan.  Big portions, lots of selection and reasonably priced.  The stuffed paratha was exceptional.  The guy working there was extremely helpful and friendly.   I will definitely go again.
Good place to go with family, specially on weekends. Excellent sort of stores, easy access, clean and with plenty of bathroom. The only problem is that needs more seats on the food court.

Excellent gallery with three floors to visit for the whole family. Paintings, pictures and sculptures. Lots of good exhibitions mostly free. Cafe provides food, snacks and drinks. Accessible for all people. Toilets always clean.

This gallery is a must see. It contains a diverse collection, all well presented.  The staff attitudes are welcoming. There are plenty of places to sit (galleries without ample seating are thoughtless and unwelcoming).  There is a cafe and plenty of very well maintained toilets. You can spend a lot of time here!

I highly recommend the free guided tour. The guide we had did an excellent job. It lasted for one hour and showcased a number of works on a particular theme chosen by the guide. This is a very good way to set up tours by volunteer guides since allowing them to choose their own theme and works to support it tends to mean they speak with knowledge and personal interest, making it that much more interesting.

When we visited, the gallery was giving away free prints of various works. These high-quality prints proved very popular I noticed. This was not only very generous, it is a very clever way to expand the reach of the gallery, exposing more people to art and hopefully encouraging a greater interest in the gallery.

Such a lovely display. Good portrayal of Modern, contemporary and traditional art. Most definitely work a visit. Can be quite busy at weekends and they close quite early so make sure you time it well. Quite central also so easy to get to by bus or tram, closest tram in St. Peter’s square. Piccadilly station is a 10 min walk away. Enjoy

I go to Manchester Art Gallery a few time every year. One of my favourites. It's worth a visit, and it always has new exhibitions and events going on! It's worth to point out, that it FREE entry. It's a very welcoming place. There's always someone at the entrance who is very helpful and will point you in the right direction.

I go to Manchester Art Gallery a few time every year. One of my favourites. It's worth a visit, and it always has new exhibitions and events going on! It's worth to point out, that it FREE entry. It's a very welcoming place. There's always someone at the entrance who is very helpful and will point you in the right direction.
Really nice park great for a walk, no lighting at night though. Free huge bonfire display worth heading down for. No parking, super tidy and well kept.

This is a beautiful park nearby my son's dorm in Fallowfield.  Lots of pathways, a nice playground for the little ones, and of course the lovely lake.  We visited on a beautiful sunny day and enjoyed an ice cream.  It's nice to find such a lovely place to enjoy the outdoors in the midst of the hustle and bustle of the City.

Lovely park. It is fantastic place for family day out. There is so many possibilities in that park . You can play football, basketball, ride bikes ( bmx track park) , skate park, tennis court, playgrounds for little kids, everything surrounded by lake. I wish that Manchester has many more parks like this one.
Great place. clean, tidy and safe. Ample space for your child to run around in. free parking just outside of the park too.

Lovely Park some people may worry about the area but I've been walking my dogs there for forty years and never had a bad experience.  After dark local kids muck about and I have heard of student muggings but they will go around alone after dark  brandishing their expensive phones in an inner city area with it's social problems like anywhere else. Sad we live in a world like this.

Amazing concert venue. I have been going to this venue for years and I'm always amazed by the ornate detail of this theater. Great space and easy to get in and out of. Great places to grab something to eat and drink nearby as well. Weather it be comedy shows, music or plays, the Palace is a great spot to enjoy.

Beautiful building in downtown Albany. Saw Justin Moore last night.. Pretty clean. Sticky floors but that's what happens when drinks spill. Would definitely go to another show there. I didn't think any seat in the house was a bad seat. We had 10th row. But I also went to back for a breather and those seats weren't bad either.

This theatre is absolutely gorgeous and sounds great. The staff is awesome and concession costs are reasonable with a decent selection of canned craft brews available for $8. I highly recommend seeing any show here.

Attended a concert here with my daughter. Small venue made it seem very personal. I don't believe there was a bad seat in the house! The baroque style 
interior was beautiful. Depending on the band, I would definitely make the four hour drive to return to the Palace Theatre.

I really enjoyed seeing my favorite band at this venue. The architecture in this place is beautiful. The sound is great. The staff was kind.  Seating for the event was first come first sat. I will definitely return for a show in the future.\mm/

I love going to the Whitworth. There are always great exhibitions taking place, so the best thing is to always check their website. I've been there twice and loved both times. Plus the area is quite new, the cafe has an amazing view to the park and their store has amazing pieces (found two great design/art books).

Beautiful space surrounded by glorious Whitworth Park. Gallery windows frame spring flowers and picnicking families. The displays and art are a real delight, they make you think and take you on a little time travel. Great place to visit on Oxford Road.

Not a great deal to see but you still end up staying for hours. Aim to go when there are specific exhibitions. Today had an interesting jazz group and poetry reading by a well known R4 personality. Oh and located next to a nice park. Addictive place.
Great gallery and it's free entry. Exchange exhibition is a must, great fabrics collection. Nice cafe and lovely arty shop. Would highly recommend the gallery or adjoining gardens and park
This is a great gallery with loads of interesting things going on, we enjoyed a brass ensemble whilst amusing a toddler with the provided art basket. Had a lovely lunch in the restaurant too.

Nice, quiet restaurant with good food. Burgers and street tacos awesome. Lot of beer choices. Do not recommend salmon burgers. Too fishy. Music needs to be light jazz or light classical. Extremely nice staff. Accepts reservations. Prices reasonable.

We have eaten here twice and really enjoyed the experience both times. On our first trip I got a chicken sandwich with avocado and a mango salsa. That was delicious! This time I did a cup of tomato soup, a salad, and a side of fries. For the second time, the food was good and so was the service. I was surprised to see that they also offer brisket tacos from the nearby Juicy Pig BBQ restaurant.

I went in and was seated quickly, and then I gave the waiter my drink. He then quickly forgot about me and I sat silently for 15 minutes before I decided that I should probably go back to class before I’m late. If I wasn’t on a time crunch I probably would have stayed longer or tried to rectify it, but I wasn’t so fortunate. Overall a pretty negative and probably rare experience but it happened. Maybe I’ll try again if I ever feel up to it.
The greenhouse has a magnificent Aura inside. It's very cozy. The bar is mostly where I spend my time as it is very comfortable and has a relaxing setting. The food is to die for.
Ashley did a great job!  Cool place.  Nice ambiance.  Fish n chips was great.

Seriously nice. 

Visited with friends on Saturday night, had loads! Baked feta, deep fried feta, hummus, garlic mushrooms, meatballs. Really tasty. 

Mains were just superb. King prawns, mousakka, lamb kebab, stuffed chicken, sliced beef special. Amazing!

Have been coming to Kosmos on and off for about 22 years or so. Never had a bad meal. NEVER. That’s pretty impressive. 

Service is fantastic too, just incredibly friendly hardworking people. It often gets super busy from about 8 onwards but the staff just continue to do a great job of looking after you. 

Great place.
Exceptional Greek fare. Watch out for the squid starter if you're not a fan of spice, it is blow your face off hot, but delicious! Would highly recommend this restaurant!
Great little family run restaurant. The food was amazing- best halloumi I've ever had. Staff were also really friendly and welcoming. Will definitely be back some time soon.
Fantastic dinner beautiful authentic Greek Cypriot food. Proper family business made to feel really welcome shame you don't have 6 stars

One of my favourite places to go out for dinner in Manchester. Scrummy home-cooked meals and lovely warm service all in a homely taverna! Always enjoy talking to the friendly waiter in there. Highly recommend the “Greek lasagna” and the battered aubergine for starters... mm mmmm! Delicious!👍🏼 Never leave this place not smiling!

Really liked this bar, it was small inside but it did have a top floor where you could sit as well.
The bar staff were very busy but we're good at mixing the cocktails and they serve different types of ale which I believe were very nice.
From the outside you probably wouldn't want to venture in but it's well worth doing as a friendly place.
We didn't eat there but saw a few people eating and it looked really good with good portions of food as well as looking tasty, so would try if I went again

Really liked it here and will definitely come again. We came at happy hour and it was so cheap. The staff were very helpful and one of the best things that my friend particularly liked was the inside smoking area. Good area of the northern quarter. Only thing with the happy hour is that the shots ended up costing more than the actual spirits but its no drama it is what it is.

We came here 6 years ago and absolutely loved their roast dinners!! We loved it so much when we did a reunion last weekend we went back and were not disappointed! Defo best place for a Sunday roast in Manchester

Excellent food in a casual setting. Dog friendly and well priced. The staff are chatty and well mannered. Good cocktail menu and lots of different beers on tap not to mention the extensive bourbon list. Will be back very soon.
Cool place. Nice staff good beer, decent food. Simple really. Staple of the NQ for years now and hasn't changed much which is a good thing. Saw Johnny Marr there a while back which made my day

This museum was a real treat. They had many interesting exhibits. It was fun to see some things that were in the museum when I was a kid next to the new stuff. I really appreciate how they are always working to bring something new into the museum. 

You can easily spend an entire day here. I highly recommend this place for people with kids. It isn't as interactive as a children's museum, but it isn't as hands-off as many other museums we've been to. They have a good mix to keep kids engaged. We will definitely visit again.

I went here as a kid and remember it being awesome. This time we didn't even but tickets, they are crazy expensive and they want 20 bucks to park in the garage on top. The basic museum cost is pricey and if you want to do anything extra there it cost more, like the submarine, it cost extra. The only way it's cost effective is if you are a member and go more than once, but that doesn't work when you are just visiting for the day.

Way too much to put in a review. We could have easily spent 3 days here, and saw only part of everything in our 6 or so hours available. There are plenty of interesting, interactive exhibits. The prices are high but certainly worth it. Traveling/rotating exhibitions are certainly worth seeing. Definitely accessible to children but still in depth enough for adults.

A Chicago institution. Good for kids and grown-ups alike. Although the total for 2 adults and 2 kids Rose to $167 with the u-505 and coal mine tours, a good time was had by all. The u-505 tour is great (Allison was an enthusiastic and engaging tour guide) the coal mine tour could be good, although our tour guide needed a  serious personality adjustment. You could tell that she's given this tour a thousand times and didn't care less about doing it again.

Amazing place, must visit museum in Chicago. Has limited parking space. Exhibits include historic modes of transportation and all sort of scientific inventions. A giant area of models of trains is awesome. Area with live exhibits of tornado is worth seeing also.

Do go early in the morning it is an great and amazingly large museum.
